channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Treasury nominee Yellen is looking to curtail use of cryptocurrency
item.description: Yellen argues many cryptocurrencies are used “mainly for illicit financing.”

item.title: New metamaterial merges magnetic memory and physical changes
item.description: A mix of actuator and bit-level memory.

item.title: Twitch’s Trump ban sustained after leaving office
item.description: Video-streaming account launched in 2019, faced first suspension in 2020.

item.title: Amazon offers Biden help to speed up vaccine distribution
item.description: A huge number of Amazon’s own 800,000 employees are considered essential workers.

item.title: PC fan port of early Sonic games lets you zoom the camera way, way out
item.description: This is quite literally Sonic like you’ve never seen him before.

item.title: Security firm Malwarebytes was infected by same hackers who hit SolarWinds
item.description: Group backed by a nation-state rifles through company’s email servers.

item.title: 3Mbps uploads still fast enough for US homes, Ajit Pai says in final report
item.description: Pai’s last report keeps 6-year-old broadband standard and gives ISPs high marks.

item.title: LG says it might quit the smartphone market
item.description: LG says it needs to make “a cold judgment” about its only money-losing division.

item.title: CBS All Access is dead, long live Paramount+: “New” streaming service launches March 4
item.description: The service combines CBS, MTV, BET, Paramount, Nickelodeon, and more.

item.title: Trump pardons engineer who copped to stealing a Google secret for Uber
item.description: Peter Thiel, Palmer Luckey, and others asked Trump to pardon Levandowski.

item.title: Porsche adds a cheaper, lighter Taycan to its electric lineup
item.description: At almost $20,000 less than an entry-level 911, it seems like a bargain.

item.title: The persistence of memory in B cells: Hints of stability in COVID immunity
item.description: Studies are small so far, but they’re pointing to decent long-term immune responses.

item.title: First task for Biden’s CDC director: Fix everything Trump broke
item.description: In wide-ranging interview, she also cautioned not to panic over coronavirus variants.

item.title: CentOS is gone—but RHEL is now free for up to 16 production servers
item.description: RHEL is now free for dev teams, and it’s even free in production for up to 16 systems.

item.title: Falcon 9 rocket launches, lands for the eighth time in dicey winds [Updated]
item.description: Weather appears to be good for Wednesday after concerns about recovery on Monday.

item.title: Qualcomm repackages last year’s flagship SoC as the “Snapdragon 870”
item.description: Qualcomm recycles the Snapdragon 865+, now with a 3 percent clock boost.

item.title: Fired former data scientist Rebekah Jones arrested, tests positive for COVID-19
item.description: State accuses her of unauthorized access to its computer systems.

item.title: Trump’s Clean Power Plan replacement gets thrown out by a court
item.description: Biden administration can start afresh without need to revisit existing EPA rules.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Lots of Switch games, Fire HD tablets, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on Hitman 3, Roomba vacuums, and the iPad Air.

item.title: Aston Martin’s new SUV is actually extremely good: The 2021 DBX review
item.description: It looks amazing and drives even better, but the downside is a crippling thirst.

item.title: Microsoft invests in $30 billion driverless car company Cruise
item.description: Investment pits Microsoft against Google sibling Waymo.

item.title: What psychology of mass mobilization can tell us about the Capitol riot
item.description: Research suggests disinfo and demagogues coordinate, not manipulate, the masses.

item.title: As Ajit Pai exits FCC, Charter admits defeat on petition to impose data caps
item.description: Charter cannot impose data caps until May 2023, won’t ask Biden FCC to nix ban.

item.title: iFixit tears down Apple’s $550 AirPods Max headphones
item.description: The headphones got a six out of 10 repairability score.

item.title: NASA likely to redo hot-fire test of its Space Launch System core stage
item.description: Of 23 test objectives, full data was received for 15 of them.

item.title: Ars online IT roundtable Thursday: What’s the future of the data center?
item.description: Join Sean Gallagher, Dell’s Ivan Nekrasov, and me on January 21 at 3:15pm Eastern!

item.title: Gaming the system: How GameStop stock surged 1,500% in nine months
item.description: New board members and a massive short squeeze cause stratospheric short-term growth.

item.title: How one musician took on the world’s biggest TV network over copyright—and won
item.description: “The torrent they got the music from was just called like 123456.mp3."

item.title: Hitman III review: Let’s call it Hitman 2.5 and be fine with it
item.description: This sequel’s lack of ambition will likely reinforce your murderous bias.

item.title: Wi-Fi 6E arrives at CES 2021
item.description: We round up the Wi-FI 6E routers, with Asus' model launching as soon as this month.

item.title: Parler seems to be sliding back onto the Internet, but not onto mobile
item.description: Parler is following a path laid for it by the likes of Gab and 8chan.

item.title: Report: This year’s iPhones may have in-screen Touch ID
item.description: Also, the charging port might be retired.

item.title: Scientists surprised to find that electric eels sometimes hunt in packs
item.description: Discovery raises fresh questions about how the eels communicate.

item.title: GitHub regrets firing Jewish employee who called Trump-incited mob “Nazis”
item.description: Worker was fired after writing in Slack, “stay safe homies, Nazis are about.”

item.title: Virgin Orbit just earned the orbit part of its name
item.description: “This magnificent flight is the culmination of many years of hard work.”

item.title: Apple pulls the plug on user-found method to sideload iOS apps on Mac
item.description: The now-nonviable method involved fetching the IPA file via apps like iMazing.

item.title: Samsung’s top executive gets 30 months in prison for bribery
item.description: Samsung leader Lee Jae-yong’s original five-year sentence has been cut down to 30 months.

item.title: Toyota wants to win Le Mans with its new GR010 hybrid prototype
item.description: The 670hp GR010 is the first of the new Le Mans Hypercars to break cover.

item.title: Lunar war brews and NASA gets militarized in For All Mankind S2 trailer
item.description: Joel Kinnaman reprises his role as astronaut Ed Baldwin in this Apple TV+ series.

item.title: Review: Chilling Adventures of Sabrina ends run with disappointing finale
item.description: Even the best episode of the series can’t save S4 from a sloppy, muddled final season.

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, pt. 2: The particle melting pot
item.description: In which lasers do things that make absolutely no sense but give us great clocks.

item.title: AI-powered text from this program could fool the government
item.description: Volunteers couldn’t tell AI-generated comments from those penned by humans.

item.title: After a decade, NASA’s big rocket fails its first real test
item.description: “It’s not everything we hoped it would be.”

item.title: What motivates the motivated reasoning of pro-Trump conspiracists?
item.description: New study suggests a desire to see society focus on men helps drive support.

item.title: The local politics of AirBNB’s ban on DC rentals
item.description: Traumatized residents, city officials fear a repeat of January 6 insurrection.
